title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 聖人無常心，以百姓心為心。
passages.en: (The quality of indulgence) The sage has no invariable mind of his own; he makes the mind of the people his mind.
To those who are good (to me), I am good;
and to those who are not good (to me), I am also good;
- and thus (all) get to be good.
To those who are sincere (with me), I am sincere;
and to those who are not sincere (with me), I am also sincere;
- and thus (all) get to be sincere.

passages.zh: 聖人在天下，歙歙為天下渾其心，百姓皆注其耳目，聖人皆孩之。
passages.en: The sage has in the world an appearance of indecision, and keeps his mind in a state of indifference to all. The people all keep their eyes and ears directed to him, and he deals with them all as his children.
